attributes.comment:
My wife and I are in the process of adopting a child from China. We realized this
process was going to be both time consuming and costly, however our desire and
willingness to make a difference in a child's life outweighs any of these factors.
We have completed a large part of the process and are currently waiting for a
referral, which can be another year away. We are concerned about the proposed
orphan petition increases in terms of their reasonability and justification. For
example adoption petition fees will increase 66% if this adjustment passes. Is
such an increase justified? Will these increases assist in fixing other Homeland
Security issues (i.e. illegal immigration)? Will they speed up processing times?

Both my wife and I are committed to this country and our decision to adopt.
Please do not take advantage of our position unless it?s for the greater good of the
nation and not a means of producing revenue.

Comment on FR Doc # E7-01631
attributes.title: Comment Submitted by Anthony D'Angelo
